Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Node/GreaterThan
Synopsis Greater than operator on node values.
Syntax Exp1 > Exp2
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp1 > Exp2
node node bool
Description Comparison on nodes is defined by a lexicographic ordering. Node N = F(N1, ..., Nn) is greater than node N = G(M1, ..., Mm) when:
  • N is not equal to M, and
  • F is lexicographically greater than G, or F is equal to G and n > m.
Examples 
rascal>"g"(3) > "f"(10, "abc");
bool: true
rascal>"f"(10, "abc") > "f"(10);
bool: true
